Package com.example.goldencarrot.data.db

Class WaitListRepository

java.lang.Object
com.example.goldencarrot.data.db.WaitListRepository
All Implemented Interfaces:
WaitListDb
public class WaitListRepository extends Object implements WaitListDb
The WaitListRepository class provides methods to create, update, delete, and query waitlist documents in Firestore. It interacts with Firestore to persist waitlist data such as user names and their status.

      public void addUserToWaitList(String docId, User user, WaitListRepository.FirestoreCallback callback)
      Adds the user to waitlist, and checks that the limit is bigger than the number of users currently waiting + 1
      Specified by:
      addUserToWaitList in interface WaitListDb
      Parameters:
      docId - the document ID of the waitlist
      user - the user to be added to the waitlist
      callback - a callback that handles the result (true if added, false if the waitlist full)

    • updateUserStatusInWaitList

      public void updateUserStatusInWaitList(String docId, UserImpl user, String status)
      Updates the status of a user in the waitlist document in Firestore and decrements the size field if needed.
      Specified by:
      updateUserStatusInWaitList in interface WaitListDb
      Parameters:
      docId - the document ID of the waitlist
      user - the user to update
      status - the new status of the user (e.g., "accepted", "rejected", "cancelled", "chosen")

      Specified by:
      getWaitListByEventId in interface WaitListDb
      Parameters:
      eventId - The ID of the event for which the waitlist is queried.
      callback - A callback to handle the result (a WaitList object or an error).

      Specified by:
      getUsersWithStatus in interface WaitListDb
      Parameters:
      docId - the document ID of the waitlist
      status - the status to filter users by (e.g., "waiting", "accepted")
      callback - a callback that returns a list of names with the specified status
